text: Hello, I have to use proxy between HubSpot API and Third Party's API. Is there any guide or helpful information to consider before moving forward? Thanks, Have a nice day!

Hello, is it possible to search for a contact using the HubSpot API based on a custom property? The search endpoint only allows to search on firstname, lastname, address, email and company name <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/search_contacts>

Hey <@UBQSVT1HA> can you tell me a bit more about what youare trying accomplish by having a proxy between HubSpot’s APIs and a third party?  There isn’t something that exists today, but if you tell me what you are looking to do maybe we can find some other way to accomplish your goal
The UI supports custom search properties but the API does not at this time <@UFM5653E1>
Ok thanks! Is there any way I can post this feature request to your development team? :innocent:
Yup, we have this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/custom/page/page-id/ideaslandingpage> for just such a purpose

Hey <@UFBNA9K9A>, I am trying to send form data when you submit the form using webhook. I am getting the json data. Now I want to modify the json data as the third party   uses OpenAPI and have some required json fields that HubSpot form Json data do not have. To add some fields and modify json response I thought of using proxy  in between. Also, I found that HubSpot does not allow reverse proxy. So, how can I achieve this ?
Sounds like the best solution is stand up a quick middleware server on some on something like AWS to do the JSON modification before sending ti onto the third party
Okay, I will give it a try. Thanks!

Hey, <@UFM5653E1>! In an effort to save you time, here is the most similar feature request I know of: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Search-contacts-companies-and-deals-by-custom-properties/idi-p/32113>. It’s already gotten 23 upvotes.
Hey <@UEZUS6NCX> let me know if you have any questions, I've built a few systems like this on Digital Ocean as well
with the forms api, can I submit data (fields `a` and `c`) to a HubSpot form with required fields - `a`,`b`,`c`? Is this a stupid question lol?
